Welcome to safepickle’s documentation!¶

safepickle¶

dump(obj, file, **kwargs)[source]¶

Write a json representation to the open file object

Args:
obj: object to represent file: open file object
dumps(obj, encoding='utf-8', errors='strict')[source]¶

Write a json representation of object as a bytes object

Args:
obj: object to represent encoding (str): encoding to use to encode bytes errors (str): same as encode ‘errors’ argument.
Returns:
object representation as a bytes object
load(file)[source]¶

Read a json object representation from the opened file object file.

Args:
file: file object
Returns:
object representation as a dict
loads(bytes_obj, encoding='utf-8', errors='strict')[source]¶

Read a json object representation from the bytes representation.

Args:
bytes_obj (bytes): bytes object representation encoding (str): encoding to use to decode bytes errors (str): same as decode ‘errors’ argument.
Returns:
object representation as a dict

types¶

safepickle currently supports all types supported by pickle (https://docs.python.org/3/library/pickle.html#what-can-be-pickled-and-unpickled) with the following exceptions:

No support for:

  • complex numbers
  • functions defined at the top level of a module (using def, not lambda)
  • built-in functions defined at the top level of a module
  • classes that are defined at the top level of a module
  • instances of such classes whose the result of calling getstate() is picklable
